nameEntry.part: Church of England Social Welfare day books

biogHist.abstract: The Church of England Social Welfare day books were kept by the Church of England/Anglican Social Welfare Bureau. They list basic details related to all requests and visits to the Bureau's social worker each day, including those concerning the placement of children.
biogHist.p: For access to records related to former Church of England and Anglican Children's Homes and other institutions held at the Anglican Archives please contact the Diocesan Archivist.

Many records contain personal information. In order to maintain the confidentiality of other people, a written application for information is required, and proof of the identity of the applicant needs to be provided. Where the request is about someone other than the applicant, permission from that person or other evidence of eligibility to access that information must be provided.
The Anglican Archives is not open to the public. Requests for records need to be made in writing. An appointment can be made to discuss records if required.
The Archives does not charge any fees to former residents of Church of England/Anglican Homes seeking their records.

These day books comprise forty volumes books covering the period 1967 to 1991. The volumes list all requests and visits to the social worker each day. They include the following information: (1) Name, (2) Registered number, (3) Address, (4) Referral, (5) Request, (6) Time, (7) Letters in/out, (8) Telephone in/out, (9) Remarks.

The day books provide much less detail than the Church of England Social Welfare case registers created by the Bureau in the period 1947-1954. In cases where entries include requests for the placement of children, parents'/guardians' names are included but children's names are not.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Records related to Clients of the Anglican Social Welfare Bureau (1945 - 1991)
